ja43:1.1: An ascetic keeps a viper as a pet, despite being warned it will turn on him one day. | Similar to Aesop’s fable *The Farmer and the Viper*, this story is retold in modern songs and politics.
ja43:1.4: The viper was named Veḷuka because it lived in a tube of bamboo (_veḷu_). The ascetic cared for it like a father.
